activateAccountApproveDenyOracle(uint8[].details: enable/disable rule. Disabling a rule will save gas on transfer transactions.

params._on: boolean representing if a rule must be checked or not.
params.ruleId: the id of the rule to activate/deactivate

getAccountApproveDenyOracleIds(uint8).details: Retrieve the account approve deny oracle rule id

isAccountApproveDenyOracleActive(uint8,u.details: Tells you if the Accont Approve Deny Oracle Rule is active or not.

params.ruleId: the id of the rule to check

returns._0: boolean representing if the rule is active

removeAccountApproveDenyOracle(uint8[],u.details: Removes an account approve deny oracle rule from the list.

params.ruleId: the id of the rule to remove

setAccountApproveDenyOracleId(uint8[],ui.details: Set the AccountApproveDenyOracle. Restricted to rule administrators only.

setAccountApproveDenyOracleIdFull(uint8[.details: Set the setAccountMinMaxTokenBalanceRule suite. This function works differently since the rule allows multiples per action. The actions are repeated to account for multiple oracle rules per action. Restricted to rule administrators only.

params._actions: actions to have the rule applied to
params._ruleIds: Rule Id corresponding to the actions

setAccountApproveDenyOracleId(uint8[],ui.notice: that setting a rule will automatically activate it.

setAccountApproveDenyOracleIdFull(uint8[.notice: that setting a rule will automatically activate it.
